p: The investigation of effects of hydroethanolic extract of Bridelia atroviridis bark showed a decrease in hyperglycemia, inflammatory parameters, and a restoration in haematological parameters and an improvement in antioxidative status in the pancreas of nicotinamide-/streptozotocin-induced diabetes in rats. This is achieved by antidiabetic, anti-inflammatory, and antioxidant properties of the plant extract. Bridelia atroviridis could be a good candidate for the formulation of an antidiabetic drug plant based.
